cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 mi SW of Havana, Cuba and 45 mi NW of the Isle of Youth
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the southeast and central Gulf of Mexico, then turning north toward the southeast Louisiana coast, before moving inland toward Mississippi and the Tennessee Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast between Intracoastal City and the Mouth of the Pearl River (west of New Orleans)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mississippi/Alabama border eastward to the Alabama/Florida border (includes Mobile Bay)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from the Mouth of the Pearl River to the Mississippi/Alabama border; Hurricane Warning Intracoastal City LA to Mouth of Pearl River LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (39–57 mph) with a low (≈9%) chance of sustained 50-kt (58 mph) winds; gusts could exceed 60 mph Sunday night into Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm Surge Watch in effect for Mobile Bay with possible inundation of 2–4 ft above ground if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches of rain possible Sunday–Monday leading to considerable flash, urban, and small-stream flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and life-threatening rip currents beginning late Saturday; minor coastal erosion possible.
